agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Clinton Central, Clinton Prairie, Lebanon, North West Hendricks, Rossville, or Western Boone school districts in Boone, and Clinton County -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that delivers nutritionally balanced meals to anyone in need living in Lebanon.
service_description: Delivers nutritionally balanced meals each weekday to anyone in need living in Lebanon. A physician's diet prescription is required. Two weeks' advanced notice preferred. Meals are delivered by volunteers.
site_details: Call to begin the enrollment process. -- Contact physician to request diet prescription.-- Meals prepared by Witham Health Services dietary department.
site_eligibility: Living in Lebanon city limits -- In need of home-delivered meals

site_schedule: Testing: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-4pm
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides free and confidential testing for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, including HIV, gonorrhea, hepatitis C, and chlamydia. Testing is available during limited walk-in hours or by appointment.
site_details: Walk in during Thursday testing hours or call during office hours to schedule  an appointment. -- Persons testing positive for gonorrhea or chlamydia will be directed to return to the   office for treatment. Persons testing positive for other diseases will be referred to   other agencies for treatment.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect health and safety of Boone County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, radon, tap water contamination. Oversees mosquito and rodent programs for the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Boone County

agency_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER BOONE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that partners with churches and social service organizations to help persons decrease dependence on government and community resources.
site_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER BOONE COUNTY
service_description: During the COVID-19 epidemic, providing bags of food for families in need. Bags will feed a family of four for seven meals.
site_details: Call to request a bag of food - may need to leave a voice message
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County

agency_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER BOONE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that partners with churches and social service organizations to help persons decrease dependence on government and community resources.
site_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Matches persons in need of assistance with volunteer programs through partnering churches. Depending on available resources, assistance may be provided for minor home repair/handyman services, light housekeeping/yard work, errands/shopping, moving assistance, and assistance filling out forms. Wheelchair ramp construction, food, clothing, furniture, appliances, hygiene products, haircuts, and baby supplies may also be available through partnering ministries. Program is designed to provide for most basic needs so personal income can be used for rent and utilities. NO financial assistance is provided.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail with name and phone number. -- Call will be returned within 24 hours to complete a 15-minute intake to determine whether the situation is appropriate for this program. --  Be prepared to provide monthly expenses, and personal and household income. -- Not equipped to respond to a crisis situation. -- After assessment, agency attempts to contact client within 48 hours with information on available resources.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER BOONE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that partners with churches and social service organizations to help persons decrease dependence on government and community resources.
site_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Matches persons in need of assistance with volunteer programs through partnering churches. Depending on available resources, assistance may be provided for minor home repair/handyman services, light housekeeping/yard work, errands/shopping, moving assistance, and assistance filling out forms. Wheelchair ramp construction, food, clothing, furniture, appliances, hygiene products, haircuts, and baby supplies may also be available through partnering ministries. Program is designed to provide for most basic needs so personal income can be used for rent and utilities. NO financial assistance is provided.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call for an appointment; leave name, number and brief description of need on voicemail. Generally, calls are returned within 24 hours.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Advance in Boone County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Advance in Boone County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Boone County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Advance in Boone County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Boone County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Boone County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Boone County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call for to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Boone County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of crimes in Boone County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission "Promote independence and provide enriching opportunities for older adults in Boone County."
service_description: Offers activities for Boone County seniors, including movies, computer/technology classes, outings, crafts, card games, and workshops. A free Lunch 'n Learn or Lunch 'n Laugh program is offered at this location two times per month; registration required.
site_details: Call to register for lunch programs and activities.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Lunch 'n Learn/Laugh: Monthly 1st and 3rd Wed noon-1pm
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 60 or older

site_eligibility: Open -- Seniors 60 years or older

Provides transportation to Medicaid recipients for medical appointments within Boone and surrounding counties. Offers transportation within Boone County to the general public. All rides are by advance reservation.
site_details: Call to schedule trips. -- For Medicaid participants: Call to schedule trip through South Transit.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission "Promote independence and provide enriching opportunities for older adults in Boone County."
service_description: Provides an in-home Respite Companion to provide relief for 24-hour caretakers of a person with Alzheimers disease or other conditions.
site_details: Call and ask for Personal Services to set up a regular schedule.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 60 or older (caregiver or patient) -- 24-hour family caregiver

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission "Promote independence and provide enriching opportunities for older adults in Boone County."
service_description: Matches volunteers with senior, homebound clients for companionship. Friendly Visitors visit a minimum of one hour each week. Friendly Families involve the entire family when volunteering.
site_details: Call to sign up for visits or to volunteer.
site_eligibility: To receive visits: Living in Boone County -- Age 60 years or older -- To volunteer: 21 years or older; families may volunteer as a unit.-- Available 1 hour each week.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission "Promote independence and provide enriching opportunities for older adults in Boone County."
service_description: Provides court-appointed guardianship services for persons who cannot care for themselves or manage their own affairs.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open -- Older adults; age requirement based on situation.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission "Promote independence and provide enriching opportunities for older adults in Boone County."
service_description: Offers activities for Boone County seniors, including movies, computer/technology classes, outings, crafts, card games, and workshops. A free Lunch 'n Learn or Lunch 'n Laugh program is offered at this location two times per month; registration required.
site_details: Call to register for lunch programs and activities.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Lunch 'n Learn/Laugh: Monthly 2nd and 4th Fri noon-1pm
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission "Promote independence and provide enriching opportunities for older adults in Boone County."
service_description: Offers support group for any adult who is providing care for an elderly family member or friend.
site_details: Call to confirm meeting schedule; phone registration requested but not required.
site_eligibility: Open -- Providing care of a loved one or friend age 60 or older

agency_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL OF ST JOSEPH ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH
agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides a food pantry to persons in need.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL OF ST JOSEPH ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in to receive a ticket (one per household) -- numbers are drawn randomly and clients are assisted when their number is called.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based agency providing charitable outreach, including a meal site open to the public.
service_description: Delivers free meals to homebound persons in need, living within city-limits.
site_details: Call to complete a phone assessment and request delivery.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Lebanon in Boone County -- Homebound individuals 65 years or older -OR- Individuals suffering from illnesses or disability

agency_desc: A faith-based agency providing charitable outreach, including a meal site open to the public.
service_description: Offers free weekly meals to all in need. Open service area.
site_details: Pickup curbside or dine in (restaurant style service).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based agency providing charitable outreach, including a meal site open to the public.
service_description: Offers free weekly meals to all in need. Open service area.
site_details: Pickup curbside or dine in (restaurant style service).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides training for adults to prevent, recognize, and react to child sexual abuse.
service_description: Provides training for adults to prevent, recognize, and react responsibly to child sexual abuse. Training is provided on-site for schools and other organizations. Sessions open to individuals in the community are available.
site_details: Call for availability or for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides training for adults to prevent, recognize, and react to child sexual abuse.
service_description: Provides training for adults to prevent, recognize, and react responsibly to child sexual abuse. Training is provided on-site for schools and other organizations. Sessions open to individuals in the community are available.
site_details: Call for availability or for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency matching adult mentors to Boone County youth (ages 8-17) who could benefit from a mentor.
service_description: Matches children in need with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests and goals. Mentors volunteer approximately once per week for a total of four hours each month.
site_details: To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or email to request a registration form or more information. To Volunteer: Complete the online application; an in-person interview will be scheduled, generally within one week.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County -- Youth Participants: Ages 8-17 -- Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- With a high school diploma or equivalent -- Pass background check

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency matching adult mentors to Boone County youth (ages 8-17) who could benefit from a mentor.
service_description: Matches children in need with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests and goals. Mentors volunteer approximately once per week for a total of four hours each month.
site_details: To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or email to request a registration form or more information. To Volunteer: Complete the online application; an in-person interview will be scheduled, generally within one week.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County -- Youth Participants: Ages 8-17 -- Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- With a high school diploma or equivalent -- Pass background check

agency_desc: A faith-based organization in Indiana providing transitional housing for individuals recovering from addiction to substance use.
site_name: INDIANA TEEN CHALLENGE - THE REFUGE GIRLS ACADEMY
service_description: Provides faith-based residential treatment program for female youth who have a chemical dependency. Residents must attend chapel, Bible studies, and be willing to adhere to program rules. Services include community service, life skills training, mentoring, support groups, and referrals to other social services. Ongoing support is provided while continuing their education.
taxonomy_name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit the website to download an application. An application packet may be sent upon request.
site_eligibility: Girls -- Age 13-17 -- Recovering from substance use addiction -- Willing to commit to length of stay

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to the task of animal welfare, rescue. and education in Boone County, Indiana.
service_description: Assists with sheltering and adoption of animals in Boone County. Also available are Pet Food Pantry resources, trap/neuter/return for feral and community cats, and low cost spay/neuter assistance. The shelter operates through a network of foster homes for both dogs and cats. Appointments required for all meet and greets, adoptions and surrender assistance.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm: By appointment -- Donation Drop Off: Mon-Fri noon-5pm
site_eligibility: ONLY Boone County residents and animals

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Boone County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Boone County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Boone County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Cass County

service_description: Maintains the Boone County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Boone County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Boone County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Provides behavior change information to those at high risk of developing type 2 diabetes in a classroom setting over the course of 16 one-hour weekly sessions. After the initial 16 core sessions, participants will meet biweekly and then monthly for up to a year.
site_details: Call or send an email to enroll, confirm meeting times and locations, or to ask about potential financial assistance.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Overweight (BMI greater than or equal to 25%) AND diagnosed with prediabetes via a blood test (If blood test not available, can qualify based on risk factors.)

agency_desc: "The goal of CICOA's Meals & More program is to provide appetizing, nutritionally balanced meals to older adults and those with disabilities either in their homes or at one of more than 30 neighborhood meal sites.  The program is designed to relieve hunger and food insecurity, promote socialization and address proper nutrition education." This program serves Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_name: CICOA NEIGHBORHOOD MEAL SITE - CRAWFORD MANOR
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch five days a week for area seniors. One day advance notice required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation at least 24 hours in advance.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and your spouse -- Building residents that are of any age

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering assistance to pregnant women and guardians of young children.
service_description: Counsels women in pregnancy decisions. Provides pregnancy testing and official verification; referrals for medical care, maternity housing, and adoption; pregnancy verification; post-abortion counseling; and limited ultrasound scanning. Also offers infant and toddler clothing (up to 4T), diapers, wipes, and maternity clothes at no charge. Availability varies based on donations.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit website for pregnancy testing, counseling, or to inquire about clothing and diapers.
site_eligibility: Counseling and support services: Open -- Clothing and diapers: Pregnant women and mothers/guardians of infants/toddlers

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS - SECTION 8
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Boone, Hamilton, Hendricks, and Tipton Counties. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in these counties is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Visit the website for wait list application dates  -- People already on the wait list, call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Residents of Boone, Hamilton, Hendricks, and Tipton counties -- When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS - BOONE COUNTY
service_name: WEATHERIZATION - BOONE, HAMILTON, AND HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides free weatherization of owner-occupied and rental residences in Boone and Hendricks Counties. Households must be approved for energy assistance to be eligible. Services may include attic insulation, caulking, weather-stripping, furnace repair or replacement, and heat duct and water pipe insulation.
site_details: Call or email to apply or for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone, Hendricks, or Hamilton County -- Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Landlord permission required for rental units

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Boone County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Boone County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.

service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF BOONE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds safe and affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Boone County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Boone County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application.
site_eligibility: Open -- Unable to get conventional loan (no set income guidelines) -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A non profit organization providing equestrian riding services for individuals in a safe and controlled environment.
service_description: Provides therapeutic riding lessons for people with disabilities through equine assisted activities and therapies. Activities may include developing basic riding skills, exercises, and riding trails. Lessons are conducted by a certified instructor with the assistance of trained volunteers. Riders will participate in both mounted and unmounted activities which will focus on building the communication, social and physical skills they need.

agency_desc: A state-government agency working to protect Indiana children who are victims of abuse or neglect and to strengthen families through services that focus on support and preservation. The Department also administers child support, child protection, adoption, and foster care.
site_name: DEPARTMENT OF CHILD SERVICES - BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Investigates reports of suspected child abuse or neglect and takes action on substantiated cases. Under Indiana law, any individual who has a reason to believe a child is a victim of abuse or neglect has the duty to make a report. Reports may be made anonymously.
site_details: Call the hotline to report suspected child abuse or neglect. Call the main desk to inquire about an existing case or to connect to your local DCS office.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-7pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Living in Boone, Hendricks, Marion, Montgomery, Morgan or Putnam county

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a full range of outpatient mental health services, including assessment and evaluation; psychotherapy; individual, family, and group therapy; and addiction treatment. Case management, supported employment services and referrals are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center. School-based services available at some locations. Semi-independent living assistance and vocational rehabilitation services available for adult patients within the Cummins Community Reintegration Program.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-7pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a full range of outpatient mental health services, including assessment and evaluation; psychotherapy; individual, family, and group therapy; and addiction treatment. Case management, supported employment services and referrals are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center. School-based services available at some locations. Semi-independent living assistance and vocational rehabilitation services available for adult patients within the Cummins Community Reintegration Program.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-7pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a one-on-one evaluation with a licensed mental health practitioner. The practitioner will make recommendations for further services as needed, but continued counseling is not required. A written report is available 7 to 10 business days after the evaluation.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-7pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received medical care from a Witham Health Services provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the Billing and Accounts office or contact a financial counselor at any Witham Health facility to request a Financial Assistance Application. The Financial Assistance Application may also be accessed and submitted online.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from  a Witham Health provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services)* Low to moderate income (Those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible  for free care.)

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Offers a support group for persons with diabetes and all others interested in attending. Guest speakers provide information and support with time allowed for group discussion and encouragement. Group meets virtually.
site_details: Call for information. -- Meets virtually; in-person meeting suspended due to COVID; call for details.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Provides comfort, hope, and ongoing support to those who are adjusting to life after the death of a loved one.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Walk in; group meets in the VIP Dining Room (back of cafeteria)
site_eligibility: Open to all who are grieving the loss of a loved one.

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Offers individualized breastfeeding support classes for new mothers to ask questions, weigh their babies, relax, and enjoy themselves. The class is facilitated by a lactation nurse; by appointment.
site_details: Call to schedule; classes held in the obstetrics department.
site_eligibility: New mothers and their babies

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Offers a support group for all who have been affected by cancer, including patients, survivors, family, friends, and caregivers. All types of cancers are discussed in an informal setting. No registration required.
site_details: Call to confirm time, then walk in. -- This group meets in the South Pavilion Lobby.
site_eligibility: Affected by cancer

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Offers a support group for caregivers, family members, and friends of persons suffering from Alzheimer's disease. Participants receive emotional support, problem-solving suggestions, and the latest information about research. Meetings are confidential; no registration required.
site_details: Walk in; group meets in the VIP Dining Room (back of cafeteria)
site_eligibility: Caregivers, family, friends, and persons suffering from Alzheimer's disease

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Offers inpatient behavioral health services designed for seniors suffering from acute psychiatric symptoms.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Physician referral and assessment required
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Requiring inpatient psychiatric care

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members
